intro: Crabbea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed crabbea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a corm-like underground stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Crabbea longipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
